member.name: M:Serilog.Sinks.Seq.HttpLogShipper.Dispose
member.summary: Performs application-defined tasks associated with freeing, releasing, or resetting unmanaged resources.

member.name: M:Serilog.Sinks.Seq.HttpLogShipper.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Free resources held by the sink.
member.param: If true, called because the object is being disposed; if false, the object is being disposed from the finalizer.

member.name: P:Serilog.Sinks.Seq.HttpLogShipper.MinimumAcceptedLevel
member.summary: Get the last "minimum level" indicated by the Seq server, if any.

member.name: T:Serilog.SeqLoggerConfigurationExtensions
member.summary: Extends Serilog configuration to write events to Seq.

member.name: M:Serilog.SeqLoggerConfigurationExtensions.Seq(Serilog.Configuration.LoggerSinkConfiguration,System.String,Serilog.Events.LogEventLevel,System.Int32,System.Nullable{System.TimeSpan},System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Int64})
member.summary: Adds a sink that writes log events to a http://getseq.net Seq event server.
member.param: The base URL of the Seq server that log events will be written to.
The minimum log event level required in order to write an event to the sink.
The maximum number of events to post in a single batch.
The time to wait between checking for event batches.
Path for a set of files that will be used to buffer events until they can be successfully transmitted across the network. Individual files will be created using the pattern -{Date}.json.
A Seq API key that authenticates the client to the Seq server.
The maximum size, in bytes, to which the buffer log file for a specific date will be allowed to grow. By default no limit will be applied.
member.returns: Logger configuration, allowing configuration to continue.
